conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric-like model: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, and removed ceiling/roof exposing interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable interior volumes; cutaway is clean. Minor issues: some openings/corners look simplified and a few wall tops/joins read slightly inconsistent.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and core adjacency mostly matches (dining-kitchen-living/central hall-bedroom-toilet/wash cluster present). However, the right/bottom stair/entry zone geometry appears altered vs the 2D plan (proportion/shape and partition placement), and several door/window locations are not verifiable or appear simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Dining table and bed are present; basic kitchen counter/appliance block is present. Bathroom fixtures are not clearly modeled; living-room furniture is minimal/absent compared to plan expectations.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with decent lighting and materials, but text labels are present inside the 3D render (UI/annotation contamination) and some openings are visually ambiguous.

detected_errors.description: Notable layout distortion/simplification in the right-bottom stair/entry region compared to the 2D plan (shape/proportions/partitioning differ).
Door/window placement and sizing are simplified and not consistently verifiable against the 2D plan.
Bathroom fixtures and living-room furniture are missing or too minimal to confirm room identity from furnishings.
Text labels appear inside the 3D render, reducing presentation score.

summary: This is a genuine 3D cutaway with strong volumetric conversion, but it shows moderate layout deviations (notably around the entry/stair zone) and simplified/unclear openings and fixtures.
